title.rendered: University College Cork International Scholarships, Ireland

content.rendered:
Finding scholarship for International students in Ireland, apply for University College Cork International Scholarship.

Contents on This Page

Toggle
  • College of Business And Law Scholarship Highlights
  • Eligibility
  • How Can I Apply?
  • Benefits

For its International Undergraduate Scholarships in the College of Business and Law, the University College of Cork is now accepting applications. These are for students who have done well in school and want to go to college.

This scholarship for international students who are interested in applying to the university’s undergraduate program was established.

Established in 1845, University College Cork currently enrolls 21,000 students, including 15,000 undergraduates and 4,400 postgraduate and research students. In Ireland, UCC is a highly competitive and research-intensive institution.

Candidates will acquire the knowledge and abilities necessary to prepare for their future careers and smoothly transition from student to professional. They would have access to a world-class environment and a variety of cultural activities to help them improve in a variety of fields.

College of Business And Law Scholarship Highlights

  • University: University College Cork
  • Department: School of Law, College of Business and Law
  • Course Level: Undergraduate
  • Award: €5,000 per Year.
  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: International
  • The award can be taken in Ireland
  • Application Deadline: Open

Eligibility

Candidates must satisfy all of the following requirements in order to be eligible for the College of Business and Law International Undergraduate Scholarships:

  • Countries eligible: Non EU
  • Subjects Eligible : College of Business and Law Bachelor’s degree from Cork University’s College of Business and Law and School of Law.
  • The following requirements must be met by applicants to be considered for the College of Business and Law Scholarships:
  • Full-time undergraduate students from non-EU countries attending Cork University’s Business School, School of Law, and College of Business and Law.

Read Also>>>> GMIT Non-EU Student Scholarship in Ireland | Apply Now

How Can I Apply?

To apply for the College of Business and Law International Undergraduate Scholarships, please follow the application instructions below:

  • Students must have to take admission in the undergraduate degree at the college. This is an automatically awarded scholarship, based on previous academic results. No application is required.
  • Supporting Documents: Submit the following:
  • Academic Transcripts.
  • Degree/School leaving certificate.
  • Two academic references.
  • statement of purpose.
  • ID proof & passport copy.
  • Admission Requirements: Students must have to complete the entry requirements of the university.
  • Language Requirement: Teaching in Irish Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) is normally through the medium of English; therefore all applicants are required to demonstrate a high level of competence in the English Language.

Benefits

The recipient of one of the College of Business and Law’s International Undergraduate Scholarships will enjoy the following advantages:

Students who want to finish their education in Ireland will be eligible to receive an annual award of €5,000 from the University College Cork.

Apply Now
